meanings.definition: Lacking refinement or delicacy; rough or harsh in texture
meanings.sent1: The fabric felt coarsest against my skin.
meanings.sent2: The sandpaper was the coarsest I had ever used.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt at a gourmet dish turned out to be the coarsest meal I've ever tasted.
meanings.sent4: His manners were the coarsest, like sandpaper on a delicate surface.
meanings.sent5: The coarsest language filled the room, making everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: Of low quality or inferior character
meanings.sent1: The coarsest materials were used in the construction of the building.
meanings.sent2: The painting was of the coarsest craftsmanship.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so coarsest that no one found them funny.
meanings.sent4: His behavior was the coarsest, like a cheap imitation of a gentleman.
meanings.sent5: The coarsest workmanship was evident in the shoddy furniture.

meanings.sent1: Her speech was the coarsest at the formal event.
meanings.sent2: The painting lacked detail and was the coarsest of all the artist's works.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's movements were so coarsest that it looked like she was stomping bugs.
meanings.sent4: His writing style was the coarsest, full of errors and lacking elegance.
meanings.sent5: The coarsest brush strokes left the artwork looking unfinished.
